Diagnosis
	1. Right upper lobe lung cancer, Stage IIIB
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	Not indicated

	Radiotherapy
	Completed radical chemoradiotherapy March 2024

	Chemotherapy
	Completed concurrent cisplatin-based chemotherapy March 2024

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease

	Current issues
	Worsening dyspnoea, weight loss

	Summary of consultation

I reviewed [redacted name] today who has unfortunately experienced clinical deterioration since completing radical chemoradiotherapy in March. She reports worsening breathlessness on minimal exertion and has lost a further 3kg in weight despite dietary supplementation. Her performance status has declined from 1 to 2.

On examination today, there are new signs of superior vena cava obstruction with prominent neck veins and facial plethora. Chest examination reveals reduced air entry in the right upper zone with surrounding bronchial breathing.

The recent CT scan from 15/4/24 shows enlargement of the right upper lobe mass from 4.5cm to 6.2cm with new mediastinal lymphadenopathy causing SVC compression. Given the high PD-L1 expression (100%), I have discussed commencing pembrolizumab immunotherapy.

	Further investigations
	Urgent MRI brain

	Medication prescribed
	Dexamethasone 8mg BD for SVC obstruction

	Follow up
	Urgent review next week with scan results

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor blood glucose while on steroids
